output.conclusion: This course provides an expert-level understanding of electrical machines, equipping engineers with the knowledge to design, analyze, and optimize complex systems.
output.courseTitle: Electrical Machines: Advanced Analysis and Design
output.introduction: Welcome to the advanced course on Electrical Machines. This course delves into the intricacies of electrical machine design, control, and analysis, targeting expert-level engineers and researchers. We will explore advanced modeling techniques, control strategies, and emerging technologies in the field.

chapters.description: In-depth analysis of magnetic circuits, including non-linear materials, fringing effects, and leakage inductance calculations. Focus on finite element analysis (FEA) techniques for complex geometries.

Detailed examination of various power losses in electrical machines (copper, iron, mechanical). Introduction to thermal modeling techniques for predicting temperature distribution and optimizing cooling systems.

Advanced modeling of synchronous machines, including Park's transformation and space vector representation. Exploration of advanced control strategies like field-oriented control (FOC) and direct torque control (DTC).
Analysis of synchronous machine stability under various operating conditions. Introduction to power system stabilizers (PSS) and other techniques for enhancing stability.

modules.moduleTitle: Synchronous Machines: Advanced Control and Stability

chapters.description: Detailed analysis of induction machine vector control techniques, including direct and indirect field-oriented control. Consideration of parameter sensitivity and adaptive control methods.
In-depth study of direct torque control (DTC) for induction machines. Comparison of DTC with FOC and analysis of its advantages and limitations.
Advanced design considerations for PMSMs, including magnet selection, winding configurations, and torque ripple minimization techniques.
Exploration of advanced control techniques for PMSMs, such as sensorless control, model predictive control (MPC), and adaptive control.
Overview of emerging trends in electrical machines, including high-speed machines, fault-tolerant machines, and machines for electric vehicles.
Introduction to advanced simulation and optimization techniques for electrical machine design, including multi-objective optimization and surrogate modeling.
